greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A329697(A122111(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: For n >= 1, a(A001248(n)) = n, and these seem to be also the first occurrences of each n.
mathematica: Map[Length@ NestWhileList[# - #/FactorInteger[#][[-1, 1]] &, #, # != 2^IntegerExponent[#, 2] &] - 1 &, Array[Times @@ Table[Prime[LengthWhile[#1, # >= j &] /. 0 -> 1], {j, #2}] & @@ {#, Max[#]} &@ PrimePi@ Flatten[ConstantArray[#1, {#2}] & @@@ FactorInteger@ #] &, 105] ] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 14 2020, after _Robert G. Wilson v_ at A329697 *)
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 29 2020
